Job Title: Solutions Architect

Location: Whippany, NJ

Employment Type: full-time

Listed Skills: Engineering, Information Technology

Description:
Inclusively is partnering with a multinational universal bank to hire a Senior Solutions Architect. **Please note: this role is NOT an internal position with Inclusively but with the partner company.**
ABOUT INCLUSIVELY:Inclusively is a digital tech platform that connects candidates with disabilities, who may benefit from workplace accommodations, to inclusive employers. This includes all disabilities under the ADA, including mental health conditions (e.g. anxiety, depression, PTSD), chronic illnesses (e.g. diabetes, Long COVID), and neurodivergence (e.g. autism, ADHD). Applicants with one or more of these conditions are encouraged to apply; Inclusively does not require applicants to disclose their specific disability.
Senior Solutions Architect Whippany, NJAs a Senior Solutions Architect, you will be joining the Corporate and Investment Banking (CIB) Technology team, which is embarking on a multi-year effort to design and implement our Supervision, Controls and Surveillance platform from the ground. In this role, you will be responsible for simplifying and modernizing our technical architecture through effective design, prototyping, building, and delivering a state-of-the-art platform for managing regulatory change and risks across the Markets organization.
At our company, we offer a hybrid working experience that blends the positives of working alongside colleagues at our onsite locations, together with working from home. We have a structured approach where colleagues work at an onsite location on fixed, ‘anchor’, days of the week, for a minimum of two days a week or more, as set by the business area (or nearest equivalent if working part-time hours). Please discuss the working pattern requirements for the role you are applying for with the hiring manager. Please note that as we continue to embed our hybrid working environment, we remain in a test and learn phase, which means that working arrangements may be subject to change on reasonable notice to ensure we meet the needs of our business.
What will you be doing?Defining and overseeing the implementation of a multi-year strategy for Supervision, Controls and Surveillance to update the application monolithIncreasing mobile integration and embrace mobile-first design and development methodologiesLeading Agile Adoption for the team to ensure sustainable processes and management of Key Person Risks, Knowledge GapsMigrating to a standard technology stack by developing reusable and leverage commodity components, and implement Service Based ArchitectureOptimizing application performance by instrumenting the application profiling, finding inefficiencies and bottlenecks, and enabling real time monitoringCollaborating with business managers, sales, traders, compliance, legal, operations, and support to analyze new requirements, explain new feature, and investigate reported issuesDesigning and implementing measures to support the stability, resiliency, scalability, and performance of the application to meet End User’s expectations.Improving our developer experience, engineering expertise, improve coding standards, quality, and test practices
What we’re looking for:Proficiency in designing complex, scalable and resilient systems architectures, using modern architectural patterns (e.g., microservices, serverless architectures, data mesh, etc.)Expert knowledge in security principles, encryption technologies, and secure coding practices to protect against cyber threats and vulnerabilitiesIn-depth understanding of cloud services, architecture, and security, with experience in designing and deploying cloud-native solutions on prem and public cloudSkills in data architecture, database design and big data technologies, with the ability to leverage data analytics for risk insights
Skills that will help you in the role:Understanding of capital market products and trade lifecycleKnowledge of financial regulations and standards (e.g., GDPR, SOX, CCPA, BASEL III) and ability to design systems that ensure complianceAbility to conduct risk assessments and apply quantitative and qualitative risk analysis methods to technology decisionsProblem-solving ability to address new situations and efficiently handle any incidents which may arise particularly in performance and observability

Experience Level (if available): Mid-Senior level
